The supremacy of Thebes. —Thebes was unwilling to make peace. She had entered on a series of successes which culminated when the Theban general Epaminondas shattered the Spartan power in the battle of Leuctra, and raised Thebes to a position of supremacy in Greece. Ten years was the limit of her greatness. Then Epaminondas fell, slain before Manti- nea while fighting againsta force of Peloponnesians and Athenians; and the Thebans, though successful, assented to a peace.
